meanings.sent1: The little lamb tried to outbleat the others in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: The sheep outbleated each other during the morning feeding.
meanings.sent3: The competition was fierce as each lamb tried to outbleat the rest.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter could outbleat the chirping birds in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The wind seemed to outbleat the sheep as it howled through the valley.

meanings.definition: To cry louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She would always outbleat her brother when they argued.
meanings.sent2: The baby outbleated all the other children in the nursery.
meanings.sent3: The toddler managed to outbleat the noisy dog next door.
meanings.sent4: Her sobs could outbleat the thunderstorm outside.
meanings.sent5: The singer's voice could outbleat the sound of crashing waves.

meanings.definition: To outdo in making a loud, high-pitched sound.
meanings.sent1: The kettle began to outbleat the whistling teapot on the stove.
meanings.sent2: The excited children outbleated the school bell with their cheers.
meanings.sent3: The cat managed to outbleat the screeching car alarm.
meanings.sent4: The fire alarm could outbleat any other noise in the building.
meanings.sent5: The cicadas' chirping could outbleat the buzzing of the bees in the garden.
